title: Flood Action Groups in your areas

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under Freedom of Information Act/Environmental Information Regulations, I would like to request the following information:
- Any meeting minutes where flood action groups or other civil society bodies have contributed to discussions about flooding in the last two years.
- Any list of 'flood action groups' in your area.
- The number of FTE staff you have dedicated to flood risk management and their roles.
Yours faithfully,
Louis Ramirez

Dear Louis Ramirez,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Flood Action Groups
which we received on 17/06/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 16/07/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Louis Ramirez,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Flood Action Groups
which we received on 17/06/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
• Any meeting minutes where flood action groups We do not have any flood
action groups.
• or other civil society bodies have contributed to discussions about
flooding in the last two years. We do not hold this information as we
are not hosts of such meetings, but we are able to direct you to the
“[1]friends of groups” link on our website, many of whom cover
Sheffield’s river valleys.
• Any list of 'flood action groups' in your area. None.
• The number of FTE staff you have dedicated to flood risk management
and their roles. 4.8 FTEs
◦ 1 Flood & Water Manager (team manager)
◦ 1 Programme & Assets Manager
◦ 0.8 (1 officer, 4 days a week) Natural Flood and Water Management
Coordinator
◦ 2 Development Officers
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
